Location: Beraban, Kec. Kediri, Kabupaten Tabanan, Bali 82121
Description: is a rock formation off the Indonesian island of Bali. It is home to the ancient Hindu pilgrimage temple Pura Tanah Lot (literally "Tanah Lot temple"), a popular tourist and cultural icon for photography
Tourism/Visitor Fee (approx in USD): Rp 20,000 (Indonesian nationals); Rp 60,000 ($3.4 USD) (foreigners)

Location: Bangli Regency, Bali, Indonesia
Description: Mount Batur (Gunung Batur) is an active volcano located at the center of two concentric calderas north west of Mount Agung on the island of Bali, Indonesia
Tourism/Visitor Fee (approx in USD): IDR 100,000 ($6.38 USD) per person. Trek cost: IDR 800,000 ($51 USD) for 3 people (inclusive of guide/transfer).

Location: Uluwatu (South Kuta, Badung)
Description: The temple is regarded as one of the sad kahyangan and is dedicated to Sang Hyang Widhi Wasa in his manifestation as Rudra.[1]
Tourism/Visitor Fee (approx in USD): IDR 30,000 ($2 USD) per adult; IDR 15,000 ($1 USD) per child.

Location: Jl. Monkey Forest, Ubud, Kecamatan Ubud, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80571
Description: Mandala Suci Wenara Wana, or well known as Ubud Monkey Forest, is the sanctuary and natural habitat of the Balinese long-tailed macaque.
Tourism/Visitor Fee (approx in USD): IDR 50,000 ($3 USD) per adult; IDR 40,000 ($2.6 USD) per child.

Location: Gianyar Regency, Bali
Description: Goa Gajah, or Elephant Cave, is located on the island of Bali near Ubud, in Indonesia. Built in the 9th century, it served as a sanctuary.
Tourism/Visitor Fee (approx in USD): Adult IDR 50,000 ($3.4 USD); Child IDR 25,000 ($1.6 USD); Parking IDR 2,500 - 10,000 ($0.15 - 0.64 USD).

Location: Village, Jl. Jatiluwih Kawan No.Desa, Jatiluwih, Kec. Penebel, Kabupaten Tabanan, Bali 82152
Description: Jatiluwih rice terraces cover more than 600 hectares of rice fields along the hillsides of the Batukaru mountain range and tend to be less crowded than Tegallalang. You'll also find fewer tourist touts here, so it's easier to walk around and explore without being hassled.
Tourism/Visitor Fee (approx in USD): IDR 40,000 ($3 USD) per person; Parking: IDR 5,000 ($0.35 USD).

Location: Jl. Raya Tegallalang, Tegallalang, Kec. Tegallalang, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80561
Description: Tegallalang is a district in the Gianyar Regency, Bali, Indonesia.
Tourism/Visitor Fee (approx in USD): IDR 15,000 ($1 USD) per person; Parking: IDR 5,000 ($0.33 USD).

Location: Danau Beratan, Candikuning, Kec. Baturiti, Kabupaten Tabanan, Bali 82191
Description: Pura Ulun Danu Beratan, or Pura Bratan, is a major Hindu Shaivite temple in Bali, Indonesia.
Tourism/Visitor Fee (approx in USD): Adult IDR 50,000 ($3.4 USD); Child IDR 25,000 ($1.6 USD); Parking IDR 2,500 - 10,000 ($0.15 - 0.64 USD).

Location: Kuta, Badung Regency, Bali
Description: Seminyak is a mixed tourist residential area on the west coast of Bali in Indonesia, just north of Kuta and Legian.
Tourism/Visitor Fee (approx in USD): Varies depending on location and places visited.

Location: Kuta, Badung Regency, Bali
Description: Nusa Dua is a resort area built in the 1970s in the southern part of Bali, Indonesia
Tourism/Visitor Fee (approx in USD): Varies depending on location and places visited.

Location: Besakih countryside, Rendang sub district, Karangasem regency, Bali
Description: is a pura complex in the village of Besakih on the slopes of Mount Agung in eastern Bali, Indonesia. It is the most important, the largest and holiest temple of Balinese Hinduism,[1] and one of a series of Balinese temples.
Tourism/Visitor Fee (approx in USD): IDR 60,000 ($4 USD) per adult; IDR 30,000 ($2 USD) per child.

Location: Kuta District, Badung Regency, southern Bali
Description: Kuta is a tourist area, administratively an urban village (kelurahan), and the capital of Kuta District, Badung Regency, southern Bali, Indonesia. A former fishing village, it was one of the first towns on Bali to see substantial tourist development, and as a beach resort remains one of Indonesia's major tourist destinations.
Tourism/Visitor Fee (approx in USD): No entrance fee. Beach chairs with umbrellas cost Rp 50,000 ($3.4 USD).

Location: Jl. Pura Telaga Mas Lempuyang, Tri Buana, Kec. Abang, Kabupaten Karangasem, Bali 80852
Description: Pura Penataran Agung Lempuyang is a Balinese Hindu temple or pura located in the slope of Mount Lempuyang in Karangasem, Bali. Pura Penataran Agung Lempuyang is considered as part of a complex of pura surrounding Mount Lempuyang, one of the highly regarded temples of Bali.
Tourism/Visitor Fee (approx in USD): Entrance fee: Rp 55,000. Sarong rent: Rp 10,000 ($0.65 USD). Shuttle bus (return): Rp 50,000 ($3.2 USD).

Location: Karangasem regency in East Bali
Description: Sidemen Valley evokes the feel of Old Bali, before the tourist throngs descended on the island. Sleepy villages snuggle in the valley amid cascading rice terraces, and cloud-capped Mount Agung looms in the background like a benevolent sentry.
Tourism/Visitor Fee (approx in USD): Varies depending on location and activities.

Location: Jl. Tirta, Manukaya, Kec. Tampaksiring, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80552
Description: Tirta Empul temple (Indonesian: Pura Tirta Empul) is a Hindu Balinese water temple located near the town of Tampaksiring, Bali, Indonesia. The temple compound consists of a petirtaan or bathing structure, famous for its holy spring water, where Balinese Hindus go to for ritual purification. The temple pond. has a spring which gives out fresh water regularly, which Balinese Hindus consider to be holy or amritha.[1] Tirta Empul means Holy Spring in Balinese.
Tourism/Visitor Fee (approx in USD): IDR 50,000 ($3.4 USD) per adult; IDR 25,000 ($1.7 USD) per child.

Location: Buleleng Regency, Bali, Indonesia
Description: West Bali National Park (Indonesian: Taman Nasional Bali Barat) is a national park located in Buleleng Regency, Bali, Indonesia.

Location: Uluwatu St, Ungasan, South Kuta, Badung Regency, Bali 80364
Description: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park (Indonesian: Taman Budaya Garuda Wisnu Kencana), or GWK, is a tourist destination and attraction located at Ungasan, Badung on the island of Bali, Indonesia, about 10–15 minutes drive from Ngurah Rai International Airport. It is devoted to the Hindu god Vishnu, and his mount, Garuda, the mythical bird who became his companion.

Location: Jl. Raya Singapadu, Singapadu, Kec. Sukawati, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80582
Description: Large zoo featuring orangutans, elephants & African lions, plus interactive encounters & shows.
Tourism/Visitor Fee (approx in USD): Starting from Rp 90,000 ($6 USD).

Location: Jl. Serma Cok Ngurah Gambir Singapadu, Batubulan, Kec. Sukawati, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80582
Description: Animal park with exotic-bird shows, feedings & displays, plus reptiles, native plants & a cafe.
Tourism/Visitor Fee (approx in USD): Bali Bird Park: IDR 385,000 ($24.54 USD) per adult, IDR 192,500 ($12.27 USD) per child (2-12 yrs). Reptile Park: IDR 100,000 ($6.37 USD) per adult, IDR 50,000 ($3.2 USD) per child (3-10 yrs).

Location: Jalan Raya Abang Desa Adat, Ababi, Kec. Abang, Kabupaten Karangasem, Bali 80852
Description: Elegant spiritual retreat & gardens surrounded by natural springs, with swimming & picnicking.
Tourism/Visitor Fee (approx in USD): Entrance: Rp 50,000 ($3.19 USD) for international tourists. Swimming pool: extra Rp 20,000 ($1.27 USD).

Location: Jl. Ir. Sutami, Kemenuh, Kec. Sukawati, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80581
Description: Scenic waterfall in a lush jungle setting above a shallow bathing area, with cafes nearby.
Tourism/Visitor Fee (approx in USD): 15,000 IDR ($0.96 USD) per adult; 10,000 IDR ($0.64 USD) per child.

Location: Jl. Dewi Saraswati No.7, Bongkasa Pertiwi, Kec. Abiansemal, Kabupaten Badung, Bali 80352
Description: Adventure outfit offering a range of tours, rafting trips & rope swings with jungle views.
Tourism/Visitor Fee (approx in USD): 10 USD to 45 USD

Location: Jl. Kartika Plaza, Tuban, Kec. Kuta, Kabupaten Badung, Bali 80361
Description: Lively water park with a rides for all ages, plus restaurants, a food court & a swim-up bar.
Tourism/Visitor Fee (approx in USD): Single day pass: IDR 355,000 ($22.63 USD) per child (2-11 yrs); IDR 495,000 ($31.55 USD) per adult. Family pass (2A, 2C): IDR 1,565,000 ($99.75 USD).

Location: Kelusa, Payangan, Jl. Raya Campuhan, Sayan, Kecamatan Ubud, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80571
Description: Lush, scenic locale known for its mellow hiking trails & sweeping hilltop views.
Tourism/Visitor Fee (approx in USD): Free

Location: Jl. Prof. Dr. Ida Bagus Mantra No.km 19, Serongga, Kec. Gianyar, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80551
Description: Family-friendly locale offering safaris for animal viewing, elephant rides & a water park.
Tourism/Visitor Fee (approx in USD): Entry fee: IDR 720,000 ($45.89 USD) per adult; IDR 576,000 ($36.71 USD) per child. Pickup service: extra IDR 450,000 ($28.68 USD) per car (return).

Location: Jl. Raya Puputan No.142, Panjer, Denpasar Selatan, Kota Denpasar, Bali 80234
Description: Ornate, landmark monument to the Balinese people, with a grassy surrounding park.
Tourism/Visitor Fee (approx in USD): IDR 30,000 per adult; IDR 15,000 per child ($0.96 - 1.91 USD).

Location: Jalan Raya Sukawati, Sukawati, Kec. Sukawati, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80582
Description: Colorful marketplace with merchants selling apparel, jewelry, locally made souvenirs & more.
Tourism/Visitor Fee (approx in USD): Varies depending on purchased items.

Location: Ujung Water Palace, Tumbu, Kec. Karangasem, Kabupaten Karangasem, Bali 80811
Description: This scenic, former water palace built in 1909 features gardens, large pools & historical photos.

Location: Jl. Raya Denpasar Bedugul km. 36, Mekarsari, Baturiti, Mekarsari, Tabanan, Mekarsari, Kec. Baturiti, Kabupaten Tabanan, Bali 82191
Description: Beatiful Garden Located in Jalan Raya Denpasar, Bali.
Tourism/Visitor Fee (approx in USD): Starting from 45,000 IDR ($2.87 USD).

Location: Jl. Penglipuran, Kubu, Kec. Bangli, Kabupaten Bangli, Bali 80611
Description: Traditional Balinese village selling handicrafts & local produce & offering homestay accommodation.
Tourism/Visitor Fee (approx in USD): Starting from 50,000 IDR ($3.48 USD).

Location: Jalan Banjar, Banjar, Kec. Banjar, Kabupaten Buleleng, Bali 81152
Description: Hot springs complex surrounded by tropical gardens offering pools & showers, plus an eatery & a spa.
Tourism/Visitor Fee (approx in USD): Starting from 20,000 IDR ($1.40 USD).

Location: Jl. Raya Pujung Kaja, Sebatu, Kec. Tegallalang, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80561
Description: Sprawling venue with lush, tropical vegetation, coffee & tea tastings & a zipline through foliage.
Tourism/Visitor Fee (approx in USD): Starting from 100,000 IDR ($6.37 USD).

Location: CFX9+9GG, Jl. Raya Goa Lawah, Pesinggahan, Kec. Dawan, Kabupaten Klungkung, Bali 80761
Description: This small, 11th-century Balinese Hindu temple was constructed around a bat-filled cave.
Tourism/Visitor Fee (approx in USD): Starting from 20,000 IDR ($1.40 USD).

Location: Jl. Pantai Batu Bolong, Canggu, Kec. Kuta Utara, Kabupaten Badung, Bali
Description: This well-known sandy beach near shops & restaurants is popular with surfers & has board rentals
Tourism/Visitor Fee (approx in USD): Parking fee: 5,000 IDR (car), 2,000 IDR (motorcycle) ($0.13 - 0.32 USD).
